PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: T.H. Banks, 2128 -1/2 Wylie Avenue and Honey Hunt, 2306 Reed Street, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 18, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think that refuse drivers and collectors should be tipped at Christmas time? Is service affected if they are not?" T.H. Banks' answer reads: "I don't see any harm.  I always do.  I don't think that the service will be affected if the collectors do or do not receive tips."  Honey Hunt's answer reads: "I think that is all right at Christmas time, but not every time they collect rubbish.  Regardless of whether they get a tip or not you should still get service."
TitMainTitle: T.H. Banks wearing hat with wide band and patterned shirt, standing with right hand in pocket, next to Honey Hunt wearing dark coat with large buttons, standing in front of ribbed metal wall
